isRightSection.title: Is Pixie Cut Right for Me? Let's Break It Down
textContent: Thinking about going for a pixie cut? Great choice! But not every style fits every face. Here's what to know:

Your face shape and hairline play a big role. Pixie cuts look amazing on oval, heart, and square-shaped faces. If you have a rounder face or high hairline, it can still work—just choose the right pixie style.
Think about your hair texture and thickness. Pixies are awesome for thick, straight, or wavy hair. Thin or curly hair? No worries—a layered or longer pixie might work better.
Pixie cuts are super low-maintenance. You save time, money, and effort. No long blow-dries. No product overload. And in hot weather? Total comfort. Cool neck, cool head.

additionalSection.title: How to Keep Your Pixie Cut Looking Fresh
textContent: A pixie cut is low-maintenance, but a little care goes a long way. Trim it every 4–6 weeks to keep the shape crisp. Short hair grows fast, so regular cuts help avoid the 'growing out mess.'

You don't need a drawer full of products. A dab of styling cream or texturizing spray does the job. Want volume? Blow-dry with your fingers for lift. Prefer soft and sleek? Just air dry—it still looks great.
Daily care is super fast. Washing and drying takes just minutes. You'll use less shampoo, spend less time, and save money. That's why pixie cuts are perfect for busy mornings and hot, humid weather.

image.alt: pixie cut maintenance tips and styling

additionalSection.title: What If I Don't Like My Pixie Cut?
textContent: Feeling weird after your pixie cut? You're not alone. The 'in-between' phase is awkward for many. Try headbands, clips, or even a fun hat to get through it in style.
Hair grows about half an inch each month. Within 3–4 months, you can shape it into a bob. In under a year, you'll be back to shoulder length.
Need options during the grow-out? Go for layers, soft bangs, or short shags. These help your hair look styled—even while it's growing.
And next time? Use Hairstyle AI to preview a new cut before you commit. It's free, fast, and lets you try over 60 styles with zero risk.

image.alt: pixie cut grow out styles and options

howToUseSection.title: How to Try a Pixie Cut with Hairstyle AI
howToUseSection.description: It's super easy! Just upload your photo, choose your style, and let AI do the work. Try as many pixie cuts as you like, totally free.

steps.title: Step 1: Upload Your Photo
steps.description: Pick a clear photo that shows your full face. We support JPG, JPEG, and PNG files under 3MB. Make sure your hair is away from your face for best results. No fancy background needed—just good lighting and your smile.

steps.title: Step 2: Choose Your Cut and Color
steps.description: Select the pixie cut style you want to try. You can go bold, soft, edgy, or classic. Pick a color you love—or test a few.

steps.title: Step 3: Generate Your New Look
steps.description: Click 'Generate' and let the AI analyze your face and features. In about a minute, your new look appears. It's fast, automatic, and super realistic.

steps.title: Step 4: Download or Share
steps.description: Love it? Download your photo instantly. Want opinions? Share with friends on Instagram, Snapchat, or wherever you like. No data saved. No pressure.

image.alt: How to use pixie cut filter - step by step demonstration

ctaSections.title: Fun with Friends on Social Media
ctaSections.description: Want to prank your bestie or just try a fun new look for TikTok? Our pixie cut AI filter makes it easy. Upload your photo and instantly see yourself with short hair. You can try bold styles, funny cuts, or even look like a celebrity. Then download and share your new look on Instagram, Snapchat, or wherever you hang out online. It's a great way to get your friends' reactions—or even ask what they think before making a real hair change. Whether it's for fun, laughs, or serious style planning, you'll love seeing yourself with a fresh pixie vibe.

ctaSections.title: See Yourself in Different Colors
ctaSections.description: Ever wondered if blonde, red, or even blue suits you? With our pixie cut filter, you don't have to guess. You can try 19 different hair colors in one place—no dye, no mess. Just upload your photo, pick your favorite short style, and start testing shades like platinum, chestnut, burgundy, or rose gold. You'll see how each color looks on your real face, with your skin tone and features. Mix and match styles and colors until you find your perfect combo. It's safe, fun, and takes just seconds. Change your hair color as often as you want—risk-free.

image.alt: pixie cut color options - different hair colors for short styles

faqConfig.question: How do I grow out a pixie cut?
faqConfig.answer:
Step 1: Trim the sides every few weeks to keep the shape neat.
Step 2: Let the top grow longer and avoid cutting it too much.
Step 3: Try styles like curtain bangs or a bob in-between.
Step 4: Use light styling cream to control volume and shape.

faqConfig.question: Is a pixie cut right for my face shape?
faqConfig.answer: Pixie cuts look good on almost every face shape—oval, heart, round, and square. Our AI face analyzer checks your features and helps suggest styles that bring out your best look. You can try multiple pixie styles online before making a decision.

faqConfig.question: How realistic is the pixie cut filter?
faqConfig.answer: The filter uses AI to carefully map your face shape, hairline, and features. It blends the hairstyle into your photo with high precision, giving a lifelike result that looks like you actually got the cut. Most users say the effect looks just like a salon result.

faqConfig.question: Is it for all ages?
faqConfig.answer: Yes! The pixie cut filter works great for users of all ages. Whether you're a teen trying something trendy or an adult wanting a fresh look, the AI adjusts the style naturally to match your features and age, so it always looks fitting.

faqConfig.question: Is the pixie cut filter free to use?
faqConfig.answer: Yes! Hairstyle AI is completely free to try. You can generate up to 5 new looks per day. No sign-up is needed. Just upload your photo, pick your style, and you're done. It's fast, simple, and risk-free.

faqConfig.question: What if I have thinning hair?
faqConfig.answer: If you have thinning hair, don't worry. Hairstyle AI shows styles that help create the look of fuller volume. You can explore shorter cuts with more texture, or pixie styles with layers that make thin hair appear thicker. It's a great way to try confident looks without stress.

faqConfig.question: How accurate is it for my hairline?
faqConfig.answer: Hairstyle AI detects your real hairline from the uploaded photo using face-mapping technology. This ensures the new style fits your natural edges and doesn't look pasted on. The results feel tailored to your unique face.

faqConfig.question: What are the benefits of a pixie cut?
faqConfig.answer: A pixie cut is bold, stylish, and low-maintenance. It saves time on drying and styling, feels light and cool in warm weather, and brings focus to your face and eyes. Many users say it boosts their confidence and gives a fresh, modern vibe.

faqConfig.question: How long does it take to grow out a pixie?
faqConfig.answer: On average, it takes 6–12 months to fully grow out a pixie cut. Hair grows about half an inch per month. You can shape it into cute in-between styles like a shag or layered bob as it grows.

faqConfig.question: How do I style a pixie cut every day?
faqConfig.answer: Styling a pixie cut is quick. Use a bit of wax, mousse, or cream to shape it. You can go sleek, messy, or textured. Use your fingers or a small comb to style in under 5 minutes—no heat needed.

faqConfig.question: How does a pixie cut look on fine curly hair?
faqConfig.answer: Pixie cuts can look amazing on fine curly hair if styled right. Go for soft layers or a side-swept shape to bring volume and bounce. It helps define curls without making them flat or frizzy.

faqConfig.question: How does a pixie cut look on thick curly hair?
faqConfig.answer: On thick curly hair, pixie cuts give a bold, full look. Tapered sides or undercuts help reduce bulk, while leaving texture on top. It keeps curls defined while making the style easier to manage and style daily.
